SRes::OntologyTerm.name: VCPA
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: NP/Indel Variant Calling Pipeline and data management tool used for analysis of whole genome and exome sequencing (WGS/WES) for the Alzheimerâ€™s Disease Sequencing Project; https://www.niagads.org/resources/tools-and-software/vcpa

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: FGC xQTL pipeline
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: ADSP FunGen xQTL analysis pipeline

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: GRCh38
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: GRCh38 reference genome; https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/grc/human

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: GRCh37
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: GRCh37 reference genome; https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/grc/human

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: log2 transformation
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: A logarithmic transformation that uses the base-2 logarithm.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: mass spectrometry
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: Spectrometry where the sample is converted into gaseous ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: atomic force microscopy
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen, line by line, and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: bright-field microscopy
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with light transmitted from a source on the opposite side of the specimen from the objective.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: material property
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: An experimental factor which is a property or characteristic of some other entity.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: quality
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: quality of a material

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: metagenomics analysis
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: A molecular assay that is used to analyze metagenomic data; genetic material recovered directly from environmental samples for genomic research.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: compound library screening
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: High throughput sample analysis of collections of compounds that provide a variety of chemically diverse structures that can be used to identify structure types that have affinity with pharmacological targets.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: high throughput sample analysis
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: An assay that allows for high throughput analysis of samples.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: RNAi screening
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: High throughput sample analysis of RNAi molecules for potential application in gene knockdown or gene silencing of target genes.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: small molecule screening
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: High throughput sample analysis of small molecules for purpose such as drug discovery, or biochemical, genetic or pharmacological tests.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: functional magnetic resonance imaging
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: A magnetic resonance imaging technique that measures brain activity by detecting associated changes in blood flow. The procedure is similar to MRI but uses the change in magnetization between oxygen-rich and oxygen-poor blood as its basic measure.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: imaging technique
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: A technique used to create a representation or reproduction of an object's outward form; especially a visual representation (i.e., the formation of an image).

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: positron emission tomography
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: An imaging technique that produces a three-dimensional image or picture of functional processes in the body. The system detects pairs of gamma rays emitted indirectly by a positron-emitting radionuclide (tracer), which is introduced into the body on a biologically active molecule. Three-dimensional images of tracer concentration within the body are then constructed by computer analysis.

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: biosample/biosource attribute
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: a characteristic or property of the biosample or biosource

SRes::OntologyTerm.name: sample attribute
SRes::OntologyTerm.definition: a characteristic or property of a processed sample
